quotes.text: We swat at flies, snuff out flame,
Feral flame of Agheel, burn true...
Blessed we, at your side, on this journey.

summaries.summary_text: This NPC voiceover bank contains 175 entries with 20 motif mentions across 9 unique motifs. The Sacred Flame motif is dominant (7 hits; example lines: “We swat at flies, snuff out flame,” lore_id=0288b92ad44001ed; “Feral flame of Agheel, burn true...,” lore_id=1a2174311feb51d0). Scarlet Rot is a notable secondary motif (5 hits). The Pilgrim & Journey motif appears (2 hits; example: “Blessed we, at your side, on this journey.” lore_id=1a22e49e0f07b91a). Sap & Flow is present as a minor motif (1 hit).

quotes.text: A fine sacrifice indeed.

summaries.summary_text: Cut-content NPC cut_content_eveligne_serpent_cultist is attested in 13 lore entries (lore_count=13; motif_mentions=2; unique_motifs=2) — source: lore_id edcb25442ea7698d. The recorded top motifs are "Frost & Hoarfrost" and "Martyrdom & Sacrifice" (motifs listed on lore_id edcb25442ea7698d). Noted quoted line: "A fine sacrifice indeed." (lore_id edcb25442ea7698d).

quotes.text: It must have been a dream. Strange.
There's an aberration of a blacksmith past the checkpoint that leads to Stormveil.
That of all the grudges born of the Shattering, Malenia the Rotted is the object of the most profound.

summaries.summary_text: Cut NPC Guilbert (cut_content_guilbert_redeemer) is recorded with 78 lore entries, 5 motif mentions, and 4 unique motifs. Surviving lines tie him to Storm & Tempest (lore_id=76ef842515da926d), Scarlet Rot Divinity (lore_id=7d705bb8796c66b4), and Dream & Reverie (lore_id=15e5945ea9f0a7d9). Notable lines from the dataset: “It must have been a dream. Strange.” (lore_id=15e5945ea9f0a7d9); “There's an aberration of a blacksmith past the checkpoint that leads to Stormveil.” (lore_id=76ef842515da926d); “That of all the grudges born of the Shattering, Malenia the Rotted is the object of the most profound.” (lore_id=7d705bb8796c66b4).

quotes.text: Alas, this is the immovable fate of all Albinaurics.
It's only a quaint treasure, for we who cannot make the journey.

summaries.summary_text: Albus is portrayed as an Albinauric resigned to an immovable fate (lore_id=2acc4a2d8e4a0d87) and as someone who regards certain items as a 'quaint treasure' because he and others cannot make the journey (lore_id=3680c571a3f5b4a8).

quotes.text: And I vow, that when I perfect your form.
Please, drink every last drop from the mother chalice.
Our mother chalice.

summaries.summary_text: Asimi Silver Tear appears across 76 lore entries and carries 10 motif mentions spanning 2 unique motifs: Frost & Hoarfrost (9 hits, 9 unique lore) and Oaths & Vows (1 hit, 1 unique lore). Frost imagery is prominent in lines such as “Please, drink every last drop from the mother chalice.” (lore_id=447464b83f089785) and “Our mother chalice.” (lore_id=4a3a6296ff74bca9). A vow-themed line appears as “And I vow, that when I perfect your form.” (lore_id=3d73082f1ff9e752).

quotes.text: Alright then. It's yours, if you can meet me price.
I ain't ever been more scared, neither. Rooted to the bloody spot...

summaries.summary_text: Blackguard Boggart appears across 86 lore entries and is tied to two motifs: Frost & Hoarfrost and Roots & Veins. The Frost motif is evidenced in the line “Alright then. It's yours, if you can meet me price.” (lore_id=1ceed54af3378450). The Roots motif is evidenced in the line “I ain't ever been more scared, neither. Rooted to the bloody spot...” (lore_id=a2fd8edf24f780bc).

quotes.text: So Ranni's fate is kept in stasis by Starscourge Radahn...
Seems we're fated to keep crossing paths.
the fight against her fate she's dreamt of for so long.

summaries.summary_text: Blaidd is repeatedly tied to the Primeval Current (see lines invoking that motif: lore_id=10957fc2241bc4ee; lore_id=11084d7f6414b9a7; lore_id=06139c19f499fd89). He explicitly links Ranni’s fate being held in stasis to Starscourge Radahn, using Gravity Wells imagery (lore_id=06139c19f499fd89). He remarks on recurring encounters—“we're fated to keep crossing paths”—implying persistent, intertwined destinies (lore_id=10957fc2241bc4ee). He also refers to fighting against a fate Ranni has long dreamt of (lore_id=11084d7f6414b9a7).

quotes.text: If you inherit the flame of frenzy, your flesh will serve as kindling,
The strength of a mighty dragon. Magnificent, but deadly.
Perhaps we will meet again, if fate permits.

summaries.summary_text: Bloody Finger Hunter Yura's lore emphasizes cold—and specifically Frost & Hoarfrost—alongside references to the Sacred Flame and the Primeval Current (see lore_id=1d22b1510d549be3; lore_id=11943a6e29ca971c; lore_id=38dd8ea9fcc0a57c). His lines evoke a deadly, draconic frost, a warning about the consuming nature of frenzy-flame, and a parting that hints at the Primeval Current and possible reunion.

quotes.text: Please, do be safe on your journeys.
The story of my rotten life...
I, Boc the seamster, am forever in your service.

summaries.summary_text: Boc the seamster is presented as a devoted attendant who offers his service (lore_id=49762e12335c7587). His associated lore repeatedly invokes frost/hoarfrost imagery (lore_id=49762e12335c7587), contains a cautionary pilgrim/journey line (lore_id=168654d24077998c), and includes a personal reference to a 'rotten life' tied to Scarlet Rot Divinity (lore_id=1e3eff4926d52397). Stats available: lore_count=186, motif_mentions=10, unique_motifs=6.

quotes.text: From your description, it can be no other than the Goldmask himself!
I will soon leave to join the noble Goldmask.
Do you know of the noble Goldmask?

summaries.summary_text: Brother Corhyn is an NPC represented in 167 lore entries, with 10 motif mentions across 3 unique motifs. His dominant motif is Trickster & Mask (7 hits), and multiple lines explicitly associate him with the Goldmask (lore_id=03dbf0c153411a63; lore_id=04870771de3431f1; lore_id=0808820afe17d251). He is also tied to Frost/Hoarfrost (2 hits) and Sacred Flame (1 hit).

quotes.text: When grace is sullied, it rots people from the inside. Breaks them.
Ah, hello. You've been busy weeding Deathroot, I take it.
I thank you, as your brother-in-arms.

summaries.summary_text: The NPC 'd_hunter_of_the_dead' appears across 128 lore entries, with 16 motif mentions and 4 unique motifs. The strongest motifs are scarlet_rot (Scarlet Rot Divinity; hits=8, unique_lore=8), root (Roots & Veins; hits=6, unique_lore=6), thorn (Thorns & Brambles; hits=1, unique_lore=1), and frost (Frost & Hoarfrost; hits=1, unique_lore=1). Scarlet Rot themes are explicit in lines about rot and corruption (see lore_id=03e9858bbcdf3c64 and lore_id=3555385b17c06fca), while the Roots motif appears in an exchange referencing Deathroot (see lore_id=32ada4ba19444c00).

quotes.text: The rotten fools. My fate was the grandest, most brilliant of them all!

summaries.summary_text: Dung Eater is associated with the motifs Scarlet Rot Divinity and Primeval Current, as evidenced by lore entry lore_id=4963b1c7fc867551. Dataset metadata lists 68 lore entries for this NPC and 2 motif mentions covering 2 unique motifs (see example lore: lore_id=4963b1c7fc867551).

quotes.text: And that is how fate has answered…

They gave me good service, or so I thought,
but it seems it was all an act.
I'm Edgar, warden of this castle as ordained by Lord Godrick himself.

summaries.summary_text: Edgar identifies himself as the castle warden appointed by Lord Godrick (lore_id: 8c7e3bc7e235e47d). He expresses disillusionment and a sense of betrayal about others’ service (lore_id: 761b7cf86232dcf2). He also alludes to fate/Primeval Current in another line (lore_id: 04d8a307dde44988).

quotes.text: So it is, that any loathing, any hatred that overshadows them...
They call me a foul and rotten witch.
The blessing is still aflame in your breast, dear.

summaries.summary_text: Fia speaks in terms of Oaths & Vows (mentioning loathing and hatred that overshadows them) — lore_id=0dfacee93cf6dcde. She is called a "foul and rotten witch," tying her to Scarlet Rot Divinity — lore_id=4202cb9a70d8d0dd. She also references a blessing that is "still aflame in your breast," linking her to the Sacred Flame motif — lore_id=50bfc1e898d78cb3.

quotes.text: Traverse Raya Lucaria; "Glintstone Eventide"…
Into the heart of the scarlet rot?
Stormveil Castle still stands tall!

summaries.summary_text: Finger Reader Crone references Glintstone & Crystalline material tied to Raya Lucaria ("Glintstone Eventide") (lore_id=6301c0fab2a5df40), poses a question about the heart of the Scarlet Rot (lore_id=6685911ca5b89296), and remarks that Stormveil Castle still stands tall (lore_id=690156c6cdc4120f).

quotes.text: "Great Elden Ring, root of the Golden Order."
Only the smoldering flame in the Great Forge of the Giants, on the highest peak in the Lands Between, can burn the Erdtree.
But special kindling is required to reignite the flame.

summaries.summary_text: Enia's collected lore emphasizes a Sacred Flame tied to the fate of the Erdtree: she states that only the smoldering flame in the Great Forge of the Giants, on the highest peak in the Lands Between, can burn the Erdtree (lore_id=628360929a913dd3), and that special kindling is required to reignite that flame (lore_id=d86100d69e558636). She also frames the Elden Ring in root imagery, calling it the root of the Golden Order (lore_id=3ddbe1451a8d6e18). Motifs supported by these lines include Sacred Flame (lore_ids=628360929a913dd3, d86100d69e558636), Fungus & Mycelia (lore_id=628360929a913dd3), and Roots & Veins (lore_id=3ddbe1451a8d6e18).

quotes.text: Make the journey.
To pass the impenetrable thorns, you seek the forge of the flame of ruin, in the snowy mountaintops of the giants.
The Great Rune dwells within the amber egg that was Radagon's gift to her.

summaries.summary_text: Gideon Ofnir is represented across 222 lore entries and is associated with 24 motif mentions spanning 10 unique motifs; the top motifs listed are scarlet_rot (Scarlet Rot Divinity, 6 hits), sap (Sap & Flow, 3 hits), flame (Sacred Flame, 3 hits), and frost (Frost & Hoarfrost, 3 hits). Specific lore excerpts illustrate these motifs and themes: a Pilgrim & Journey exhortation — "Make the journey." (lore_id=06cb1f8ce8367c0d); a Sacred Flame / Thorns & Brambles passage pointing to a forge in the giants' snow — "To pass the impenetrable thorns, you seek the forge of the flame of ruin, in the snowy mountaintops of the giants." (lore_id=19e316d77898d409); and a Sap & Flow reference to the Great Rune within an amber egg — "The Great Rune dwells within the amber egg that was Radagon's gift to her." (lore_id=4132fb2291aa3b30).

quotes.text: Thou didst me good service, Serosh.

summaries.summary_text: Godfrey, the First Elden Lord (npc:godfrey_first_elden_lord) appears in 18 collected lore entries and has one recorded motif mention: Frost & Hoarfrost (1 hit). A representative line tied to this motif is “Thou didst me good service, Serosh.” (lore_id=43ed9a20db5fe2e1).

quotes.text: But the rotting sickness erodes one's memory.
Oh how I have counted the days. Millicent shall soon meet her sisters.
Do you have an interest in rot incantations?

summaries.summary_text: Gowry speaks of hoarfrost and counting days until Millicent meets her sisters (lore_id=1282496de9e21a76). He also addresses Scarlet Rot Divinity directly—observing that the rotting sickness erodes memory and offering rot incantations (lore_id=083033a717975a74; lore_id=178231e67fa13fdf).

quotes.text: Now, rot!
The twin prodigies, Miquella and Malenia.
I dreamt for so long.

summaries.summary_text: Gurranq invokes Scarlet Rot directly — “Now, rot!” (lore_id=06b00a1acccc05ab). He explicitly references the twin prodigies Miquella and Malenia (lore_id=1ae84907f1332c7f). He also speaks of long dreaming — “I dreamt for so long.” (lore_id=27809fc148744444).

quotes.text: My name is Hyetta, and I'm journeying in search of the distant light.

summaries.summary_text: Hyetta is presented as a pilgrim journeying toward a "distant light," explicitly voiced in lore entry lore_id=2da1b9162afce43d. The character's record contains 23 lore entries in total (metadata), and the Pilgrim & Journey motif is recorded once among those entries (motif mention supported by lore_id=2da1b9162afce43d).

quotes.text: Of the swiftness of a wanderer's fury.
Stay away, Us wanderers have had enough.
How nice of you to stop by, again.

summaries.summary_text: The imprisoned merchant frames himself as a pilgrim/wanderer: “Of the swiftness of a wanderer's fury.” (lore_id=030de8ef52fdd110) and “Stay away, Us wanderers have had enough.” (lore_id=2d5184bec10f2779). He also offers a familiar, frost-tinged greeting: “How nice of you to stop by, again.” (lore_id=4ac29795dd84d719).

quotes.text: I wish to journey with you once more.
Our journey together ends here.
The thorns are impenetrable.

summaries.summary_text: Appearances: 324 lore entries; 26 motif mentions across 9 unique motifs. The figure emphasizes pilgrimage and journey — e.g., "I wish to journey with you once more." (lore_id=08b7cab24ce9d037) and "Our journey together ends here." (lore_id=0eb5f47f339108de) — framing companionship and parting. Bramble imagery presents an impassable obstacle: "The thorns are impenetrable." (lore_id=184b5370b2495aa4). The single most frequent motif is Sacred Flame (11 hits).

quotes.text: Burn me with the flame, to make me your maiden...
May the flame of chaos find purchase within you.

My sole wish is that he escape,
even if his honour should be the price.

summaries.summary_text: Irina appears across 106 lore entries. Her top motifs are Sacred Flame (4 hits, 4 unique lore mentions), Pilgrim & Journey (2 hits, 2 unique), Frost & Hoarfrost (1 hit, 1 unique), and Scarlet Rot Divinity (1 hit, 1 unique). She explicitly offers herself to flame ("Burn me with the flame, to make me your maiden..." — lore_id=008f636eb7b3a098) and invokes chaotic fire ("May the flame of chaos find purchase within you." — lore_id=00ad8fa50374eca4). She also expresses a wish for another's escape even at the cost of his honour ("My sole wish is that he escape, even if his honour should be the price." — lore_id=4b1b5e36ac1d1350).

quotes.text: Ahh, hello! How nice it is to see a friendly face!
Give me a good smack from behind with something nice and big.
I hardly think you're here to temper yourself with flame, considering that fleshly form of yours.

summaries.summary_text: npc:iron_fist_alexander has 222 lore entries, 23 motif mentions, and 6 unique motifs. His lines repeatedly evoke frost/hoarfrost (e.g., friendly greeting in lore_id=09d6910557f4d04b and the crude request in lore_id=1164fdedf2c76f80), show bawdy humor (lore_id=1164fdedf2c76f80), and include a dismissive reference to sacred flame and corporeal tempering (lore_id=22bf8c2e5ff6dee6).

quotes.text: The flowers we have now are nice, but it's a bit boring having the same ones all the time.
Even if I'm scared, I'll still fight to protect everyone.
One who protects everybody.

summaries.summary_text: Jar Bairn appears across 126 lore entries and is associated with 11 motif mentions spanning 4 unique motifs (lore_ids: 0c61d1a2c9945cf9, 12e281411e8ffa46, 1742b1ee8458ac9c). The strongest motifs are frost (5 hits), pilgrim (3 hits), scarlet_rot (2 hits), and sap (1 hit) (lore_ids: 0c61d1a2c9945cf9, 12e281411e8ffa46, 1742b1ee8458ac9c). The character voice emphasizes a fondness for flowers and variety ("The flowers we have now are nice...") and a protective resolve in the face of fear and Scarlet Rot ("Even if I'm scared, I'll still fight to protect everyone." / "One who protects everybody.") (lore_ids: 0c61d1a2c9945cf9, 12e281411e8ffa46, 1742b1ee8458ac9c).

quotes.text: Oh, indeed, it is a foul fate for a land, to be without a ruler.
Ah, nice to see you after so long.
Hmph, yes, now allow me to furnish you with a little advice.

summaries.summary_text: Kenneth Haight is represented in 99 recorded lore entries (lore_count=99) with 7 motif mentions across 3 unique motifs (motif_mentions=7, unique_motifs=3). He frequently references frost/hoarfrost in his dialogue (lore_id=3e994115ca5df632; lore_id=69c885a48e586c49). He also references the Primeval Current (lore_id=06774e10c34890a0). Representative lines include a greeting and a piece of advice (lore_id=3e994115ca5df632; lore_id=69c885a48e586c49).

quotes.text:
Left the Volcano Manor. Forging my own path now.
Making my own choices.
Well. Nice to see you again.
Lanya knows this, I'm certain. Fate has laid hard roads for us both.

summaries.summary_text: Knight Diallos appears across a large body of lore (lore_count=105) and is associated with three primary motifs: frost, primeval_current, and scarlet_rot (entity stats). Frost & Hoarfrost is attested by two quoted lines: “Left the Volcano Manor. Forging my own path now. Making my own choices.” (lore_id=98e6454303e9c00b) and “Well. Nice to see you again.” (lore_id=d485338baaca6d6b). Primeval Current is referenced in the line “Lanya knows this, I'm certain. Fate has laid hard roads for us both.” (lore_id=d736d959b9d50c80). Scarlet Rot Divinity is listed among his top motifs (top motifs data), though no supporting quote was provided here.

quotes.text: I will go with the Tarnished. So that our journey will not have been in vain.
Would you consider doing me a great service?
Then I've no choice. But to trust that this was his dying will.

summaries.summary_text: Latenna is an NPC with 69 lore entries and 3 motif mentions spanning 2 unique motifs. The Frost / Hoarfrost motif is prominent (2 hits across 2 lore items: lore_id=c9fb282e73bc9dbb, lore_id=ec990c30dd4a4e75). The Pilgrim / Journey motif appears once (lore_id=9c28a3ec212adaf2). Her lines show she asks for a great service (lore_id=c9fb282e73bc9dbb), declares she will go with the Tarnished so their journey won’t be in vain (lore_id=9c28a3ec212adaf2), and speaks of trusting that something was another’s dying will (lore_id=ec990c30dd4a4e75).

quotes.text: O, dearest Miquella, my brother...
One day, the scarlet bloom will flower again...
By the scarlet rot.

summaries.summary_text: Malenia, Blade of Miquella, appears in 13 lore entries and is thematically dominated by the Scarlet Rot Divinity motif, which is mentioned 3 times (lore_ids: 064a69b656d61d1a, 51896581e9c55e24, f7289c105c54f0ee). Her known lines express devotion to Miquella (lore_id=064a69b656d61d1a), prophecy/continuance of the scarlet bloom (lore_id=51896581e9c55e24), and direct invocation of the scarlet rot (lore_id=f7289c105c54f0ee).

quotes.text: Someone must extinguish thy flame.
Emboldened by the flame of ambition.

summaries.summary_text: Margit the Fell Omen is an NPC with six recorded lore entries (lore_count=6). The Sacred Flame motif appears twice (motif_mentions=2; unique_motifs=1), occurring in two distinct lore entries (lore_id=04fd1da8e30b6502 and lore_id=b9793d8da7aac705). Both recorded quotes invoke the flame motif (see supporting quotes).

quotes.text: Beget Order most elegant, from my tender reverie.
When thou canst share in my dream.

summaries.summary_text: Marika appears across 18 lore entries and is associated with the "Dream & Reverie" motif, referenced twice in the lore (lore_id=394b480e38054669; lore_id=85d371f7ffbbace9). Notable lines tied to that motif: "Beget Order most elegant, from my tender reverie." (lore_id=394b480e38054669) and "When thou canst share in my dream." (lore_id=85d371f7ffbbace9).

quotes.text: Lord of Frenzied Flame...
The one who walks alongside flame,
But the flames will also burn the impenetrable thorns.

summaries.summary_text: Melina is strongly associated with the Sacred Flame motif (cited instances: lore_id=008a5b9043fa2050, lore_id=8f48ed1d14a6b313, lore_id=bef7fd1b70ad47c9) and is also linked to Thorns & Brambles in one instance (lore_id=bef7fd1b70ad47c9). Metadata provided: lore_count=30, motif_mentions=4, unique_motifs=2.

quotes.text: Please, bestow unto me the yellow flame of chaos.
A frenzied flame to melt away the curses, suffering, and despair. And the Order, entire.
My people are wanderers all, which I won't deny is one reason...

summaries.summary_text: Merchant Kale is thematically dominated by the Sacred Flame—he explicitly requests chaotic yellow fire and frenzied flame in lore_id=0896b8cbece0a582 and lore_id=178ab01f48a468dc. He also invokes Pilgrim & Journey imagery about his people and wandering in lore_id=1d1d4862e4ce2e99. Across 171 lore entries (lore_count=171) and 15 motif mentions (motif_mentions=15), the top motifs recorded are Sacred Flame, Pilgrim & Journey, Frost & Hoarfrost, and Sap & Flow (see the cited lines above for direct examples).

quotes.text: The scarlet rot writhes now, worse than ever.
after unleashing the power of the scarlet rot, during her battle with General Radahn, in the Caelid Wilds.
Everything is as you said. Since inserting the needle, the scarlet rot has ceased to writhe.

summaries.summary_text: Millicent is primarily associated with the Scarlet Rot Divinity, as supported by multiple lore entries (lore_id=1f9aa04579a301d4; lore_id=348ffb115d50ea98; lore_id=61304bddff5a6d2f). Dataset stats: 113 lore entries total, 13 motif mentions across 4 unique motifs. Other motifs recorded for this entity are Pilgrim & Journey, Frost & Hoarfrost, and Primeval Current (as listed in the motif summary).

quotes.text: How it came to be known as the Church of Vows?
I welcome you, to the Church of Vows.
It is here, at the Church of Vows, that the great houses of the Erdtree and the Moon were joined.

summaries.summary_text: Miriel is tied to the Church of Vows and poses the question “How it came to be known as the Church of Vows?” (lore_id=0bce632e8bb0dda0). Miriel formally greets visitors: “I welcome you, to the Church of Vows.” (lore_id=258a8aa84f746e1d). Miriel also states that “it is here, at the Church of Vows, that the great houses of the Erdtree and the Moon were joined.” (lore_id=325bf00e594e7ebf).

quotes.text: Smould'ring with that wretched flame of ambition.
The Erdtree is firmly rooted, always.
Smould'ring with thy meagre flame.

summaries.summary_text: Morgott the Omen King appears across 38 lore entries, with 7 motif mentions spanning 2 unique motifs: Sacred Flame (5 hits, 5 unique_lore) and Roots & Veins (2 hits, 2 unique_lore). Sacred Flame is evidenced by lines such as “Smould'ring with that wretched flame of ambition.” (lore_id=0e0fde94a7d1ffc1) and “Smould'ring with thy meagre flame.” (lore_id=47ff7a373c292d50). Roots & Veins is evidenced by “The Erdtree is firmly rooted, always.” (lore_id=237761e1fb6746b6).

quotes.text: I will remain, to summon the storm.
In this ash, I can smell the ancient storm.
I will call upon the storm, to drive away the foulness that has settled on the winds.

summaries.summary_text: Nepheli Loux is strongly associated with Storm & Tempest imagery; multiple quotes record her intent to summon or call upon storms (lore_id=0730c379d1e9f300, lore_id=07404f1bb8189804, lore_id=33b8a20f8f80f18e). Metadata: lore_count=115, motif_mentions=11, unique_motifs=4 (top motifs: storm, frost, oath, primeval_current).

quotes.text: Well, water under the bridge. Now we're squared up, how about we play nice from now on?
There's a special circle, for rotten thieves like you.
And welcome to Patches' Emporium.

summaries.summary_text: Patches is an NPC strongly associated with Trickster & Mask imagery (evidence: "And welcome to Patches' Emporium." — lore_id=1c41d9e83797d3ae). He is also tied to Frost & Hoarfrost ("Well, water under the bridge. Now we're squared up, how about we play nice from now on?" — lore_id=08647359ad705b9e) and to Scarlet Rot Divinity ("There's a special circle, for rotten thieves like you." — lore_id=0bcda166d1258b3f). Metadata: lore_count=262, motif_mentions=21, unique_motifs=5; top motif hit counts: trickster=13, frost=4, scarlet_rot=2, lichen=1.

quotes.text: There's a glintstone sorcerer by the name of Sellen in Limgrave.
Knowledge of the sorcerous arts, under the tutelage of the great Preceptor Seluvis.
I am Seluvis, preceptor in the sorcerous arts.

summaries.summary_text: Preceptor Seluvis is explicitly identified as a preceptor in the sorcerous arts (lore_id=13606ada04366926; lore_id=0f4b2f9d64ed4c6e). He is connected to the glintstone sorcerer Sellen, with Seluvis cited as her tutor (lore_id=0d517f75e0f1150c; lore_id=0f4b2f9d64ed4c6e).

quotes.text: Surrendering thyself into the service of a doll-witch...
With a fateful wound, ne'er to heal.
Even in my slumber, I sensed it.

summaries.summary_text: Ranni is associated with frost/hoarfrost and invoked alongside a 'doll-witch' image (lore_id=0d88a2f891bd75ba). She bears a fateful, unhealing wound tied to the Primeval Current (lore_id=0d9af185296d4506). She also experiences perception within sleep or dreamed reverie (lore_id=0fe10b4f1d83d039).

quotes.text: I suppose I have no choice, then.
I am the recusant Bernahl, inheritor of my brother's will, and you will fall to my blade.
I won't say it twice. Stop this.

summaries.summary_text: Recusant Bernahl is presented as a named combatant who claims his brother's will and asserts his identity (lore_id=9ad21d93ef8eeaea). His speech is terse and resolute—accepting conflict and refusing to repeat commands (lore_id=23f1c449fbc94dbd; lore_id=d30872e9a4e8e158). Motif emphasis: Frost & Hoarfrost is a principal motif (3 hits) supported by frost-tagged lines (lore_id=23f1c449fbc94dbd; lore_id=d30872e9a4e8e158), and Scarlet Rot Divinity appears once in the identity/assertion line (lore_id=9ad21d93ef8eeaea).

quotes.text: Come, Oath-sworn beasts!
Come, Oath-sworn giant!
Come, Oath-sworn dragon!

summaries.summary_text: npc:rennala_queen_of_the_full_moon — Metadata: 38 lore entries; 4 motif mentions across 2 unique motifs. Top motif is Oaths & Vows (3 hits, 3 unique lore), directly attested by three quotes: lore_id=4dc1e8efc60dc14d ('Come, Oath-sworn beasts!'), lore_id=8e0ca873fff0d903 ('Come, Oath-sworn giant!'), lore_id=c48faf26a7ee89bb ('Come, Oath-sworn dragon!'). Primeval Current is also listed among top motifs (hits=1, unique_lore=1).

quotes.text: by Mother's amber.
That'd be nice, so very nice.

summaries.summary_text: NPC npc:rennala_sweetings appears in 35 collected lore items and registers two motif mentions across two unique motifs. The Sap & Flow motif is attested by the line “by Mother's amber.” (lore_id=0c9800d7cf6840aa). The Frost & Hoarfrost motif is attested by the line “That'd be nice, so very nice.” (lore_id=e525992f1b88c3a4). Top motif stats: Sap & Flow — hits=1, unique_lore=1 (lore_id=0c9800d7cf6840aa); Frost & Hoarfrost — hits=1, unique_lore=1 (lore_id=e525992f1b88c3a4).

quotes.text: Perhaps you've heard of dreambrew, the nectar of the demigods, once forbidden to we mortals?
As I said, if you'd like me to share some dreambrew with you, we'll need four doses of slumber fog, or thereabouts.
Into your dream, the world of your heart.

summaries.summary_text: Rhico (the Dreambrew Apostle) speaks of dreambrew as “the nectar of the demigods.” (lore_id=0b350d629a94de22) He offers to share dreambrew but says it will require “four doses of slumber fog.” (lore_id=100f5cfdd2ec8739) He frames this in terms of entering a dream — “the world of your heart.” (lore_id=281d17d1ef668797) All three quoted lines are associated with the Dream & Reverie motif (lore_ids=0b350d629a94de22, 100f5cfdd2ec8739, 281d17d1ef668797).

quotes.text: Greetings. Nice to see you again.
Master Hewg said it himself, actually, that I'm no mere prentice any longer.
Oh, can you pass on a message for me, if you see the little chrysalids in Stormveil Castle?

summaries.summary_text: Roderika (npc:roderika) is represented by 154 collected lore entries, with 12 total motif mentions across 4 unique motif families (Frost, Roots, Storm, Trickster). Frost/Foarhost is the dominant motif (7 hits, 7 unique lore); examples of Frost lines include lore_id=071e7f05581675cd and lore_id=3cb3d962603041b2. The Storm motif appears in lore_id=510a9c2b5e6a5646. Roots and Trickster are present in the motif summary (Roots: 2 hits; Trickster: 1 hit) but no supporting quote lore_id for those motifs is included in the provided quotes.

quotes.text: I am Rya, in the service of Lady Tanith of the Volcano Manor.

summaries.summary_text: Rya identifies herself as in the service of Lady Tanith of Volcano Manor (lore_id=c561d936c8edb873). The entry also links Rya to the Frost & Hoarfrost motif (lore_id=c561d936c8edb873). Dataset metadata: Rya has 170 lore entries and 1 motif mention covering 1 unique motif.

quotes.text: A fitting sacrifice you shall be, for the Serpent King.

summaries.summary_text: Rykard, Lord of Blasphemy is recorded with 7 lore entries (lore_count=7). The top motifs are frost (Frost & Hoarfrost) and martyrdom (Martyrdom & Sacrifice), each recorded once across the lore (hits=1, unique_lore=1 for each motif) — see lore_id=85ccbdb4029cabfb. A quoted line links both motifs and the theme of sacrifice: “A fitting sacrifice you shall be, for the Serpent King.” (lore_id=85ccbdb4029cabfb).

quotes.text: I left the serpent-slaying spear in the Lord's Chamber.
Worthy Tarnished. I left the serpent-slaying spear in the Lord's Chamber.

summaries.summary_text: Serpent Hunter Spirit (npc:serpent_hunter_spirit) appears across 18 lore entries and is associated with the Sap & Flow motif (2 mentions, 1 unique motif). In two recorded lines, the spirit explicitly says he left the 'serpent-slaying spear in the Lord's Chamber' [lore_id=197174323857d2d8; lore_id=f3ea4a434c9fb156].

quotes.text: An imprisoned monster does not deserve an apprentice, or a daughter.
I...didn't notice you there.
I see you've noticed the chains.

summaries.summary_text: Smithing Master Hewg (lore_count=124) is thematically tied to Frost & Hoarfrost (unique_motifs=1; motif_mentions=3). His lines portray a contempt for an imprisoned monster’s status — “An imprisoned monster does not deserve an apprentice, or a daughter.” (lore_id=0290c62acacd2bd1) — show surprise at an intruder — “I...didn't notice you there.” (lore_id=220a88ee0e0d9926) — and call attention to physical restraints — “I see you've noticed the chains.” (lore_id=2318ea41b6901d40). These three quoted lines collectively instantiate the Frost & Hoarfrost motif (lore_ids=0290c62acacd2bd1, 220a88ee0e0d9926, 2318ea41b6901d40).

quotes.text: Black flames have devoured the Erdtree,
Nor the rank malformed twins.
and the Lands Between are shrouded by Death's dark fate.

summaries.summary_text: npc:songstress_of_haligtree utters lines that mention black flames devouring the Erdtree (lore_id=98ac2e84de23e533), the rank malformed twins (lore_id=c46e844065d9d3b8), and that the Lands Between are shrouded by Death's dark fate (lore_id=e1fabc2f1fa9f427).

quotes.text: If Lunar Princess Ranni truly is the one who plotted that fateful night,
And the best way to find out is for you to enter her service and take a poke around on the sly.
But enough about me, what are you doing here in Stormveil Castle?

summaries.summary_text: Rogier suggests Lunar Princess Ranni may have plotted "that fateful night" (lore_id=0fe04b6d05effb30). He advises entering Ranni's service to "take a poke around on the sly" as a way to find out (lore_id=1240226e2ae30abf). He also questions the player's presence in Stormveil Castle (lore_id=15398b18c33a3de6).

quotes.text: So, you've found yourself a glintstone key.
Why not find yourself a glintstone key?
And if you find an extra glintstone key, perhaps...

summaries.summary_text: Sorcerer Thops (npc:sorcerer_thops) appears across 93 lore entries with 12 motif mentions spanning 4 unique motifs. His dominant motif is Glintstone & Crystalline (9 hits, 9 unique lore). Sample glintstone lines: “So, you've found yourself a glintstone key.” (lore_id=1cd1b9620f1cb6bd), “Why not find yourself a glintstone key?” (lore_id=21a9f9392f04d561), and “And if you find an extra glintstone key, perhaps...” (lore_id=34e77085817d5915). Other recorded motifs are Roots & Veins, Frost & Hoarfrost, and Pilgrim & Journey (each listed once).

quotes.text: But, fine. If it will help you, my apprentice, I offer my knowledge.
There you are, my apprentice.
Very well. You are now my protégé in glintstone sorcery.

summaries.summary_text: Sorceress Sellen is portrayed as a mentor who offers her knowledge and addresses the player as her apprentice (lore_id=020481399bb02066; lore_id=04cc24b737e92cd3). She formally takes the player as a protégé in glintstone sorcery (lore_id=093e755495c016aa). In aggregate data, Sellen has 214 lore entries, 75 motif mentions across 8 unique motifs; her top motifs are Frost (34 hits), Glintstone (22 hits), Primeval Current (9 hits), and Sap (3 hits).

quotes.text: If you are loath to hunt your own kin, so be it.
Rya will be disappointed, but I won't twist your arm.
I will transport you to the Lord's chamber.

summaries.summary_text: Tanith is represented across 142 collected lore entries with 4 motif mentions over 3 unique motifs (representative entries: 02395f149ad00389, 08846fb3ae66155d, 435993754c14c9cb). The Sap & Flow motif is evidenced by lore_ids 08846fb3ae66155d and 435993754c14c9cb; Oaths & Vows is evidenced by lore_id 02395f149ad00389. Notable lines: offers to transport the player to the Lord's chamber (435993754c14c9cb), references Rya (08846fb3ae66155d), and invokes an oath-like admonition about hunting kin (02395f149ad00389).

quotes.text: I didn't notice that you were Tarnished.
Well, you've done us a fine service, I must say.
the traitors were eyed by the grotesque Fell Omen, and their corpses piled high outside the wall!

summaries.summary_text: Viscount Shanehaight addresses and recognizes the Tarnished (lore_id=054d46ca001ff211). He expresses gratitude for a service the Tarnished performed (lore_id=4d8a5bd8f9cbdd0b). He also recounts traitors being eyed by a grotesque Fell Omen and their corpses piled outside the wall, linking him to the Scarlet Rot Divinity motif (lore_id=beb1f9b72c995ee2). Frost & Hoarfrost appear in two of his lines (lore_ids=054d46ca001ff211, 4d8a5bd8f9cbdd0b).

quotes.text: I welcome one of your calibre. A fellow champion in service of Lady Ranni.
Blaidd is Lady Ranni's stepbrother.
Well, it has a twin, known as Nokron. The other Eternal City.

summaries.summary_text: War Counselor Iji is an NPC tied to themes of the Primeval Current and pilgrimage, with 156 collected lore entries and top motif hits including primeval_current (6) and pilgrim (3). Iji greets the player as "A fellow champion in service of Lady Ranni" (lore_id=08bb937ead817c9e). He also states that "Blaidd is Lady Ranni's stepbrother" (lore_id=2d3b0eeea0dd99e1) and refers to Nokron as "the other Eternal City" (lore_id=427c20d372af1ade).

quotes.text: To Castle Stormveil, on the cliff.
For an audience with the Two Fingers, in the inner chamber.
You disappoint me.

summaries.summary_text: White Mask Varre (npc:white_mask_varre) is an NPC recorded across 179 lore entries with 18 motif mentions (lore_id=070a598ef18ed60b, lore_id=07b4a710382ac4f7, lore_id=0e99bf8aa9594267). His recorded lines include directing to Castle Stormveil (Storm & Tempest) (lore_id=070a598ef18ed60b), requesting an audience with the Two Fingers (Sap & Flow) (lore_id=07b4a710382ac4f7), and saying “You disappoint me.” (Sap & Flow) (lore_id=0e99bf8aa9594267). Top motifs associated in the provided data include Storm & Tempest (6 hits), Sap & Flow (5 hits), Frost & Hoarfrost (2 hits), and Primeval Current (2 hits) (see related lines: lore_id=070a598ef18ed60b, lore_id=07b4a710382ac4f7, lore_id=0e99bf8aa9594267).

quotes.text: If the fates deign it, may we meet again, Tarnished.
Obsessed by the primeval current, countless sorcerers fell to her hand.
Brave warrior, if the fates deign it...

summaries.summary_text: npc:witch_hunter_jerren is predominantly associated with the Primeval Current—multiple lines directly reference obsession and meeting by fate (lore_id=37ad8750ea393708; lore_id=094b71de5d85ba63; lore_id=5f3974a4b7e73322). He is also explicitly linked to Glintstone & Crystalline in the same material (lore_id=37ad8750ea393708). The provided motif list further records primeval_current, scarlet_rot, glintstone, and oath as his top motifs (counts from the supplied motif summary).
